summary: Retrieve exact line ranges or whole heading blocks from a cached source. Feed one or more `<alias>:<start-end>` targets and use `-Call` (legacy `--block`) when you need the entire section.

usage.description: Primary pattern for single spans. Context expands Â±2 lines.
Repeat the alias with new ranges when you need multiple snippets; JSON replies with one requests[] entry containing ranges[].
Batch different sources. Each alias yields its own requests[] object with snippet/lineStart/lineEnd.
Heading-aware retrieval. Expands to the enclosing section and caps the payload to 80 lines.

options.impact: Expands each range. Keep N small (0-3) for prompt efficiency. Legacy alias: -c<N>.
Return the entire heading that contains the requested lines (great for API intros, tables, or multi-step guides).
Legacy alias for -C all. Still supported but -C all is preferred.
Hard limit when using -Call so agents avoid oversized payloads.
Structured payload with requests[]. Each entry exposes alias, source, snippet + lineStart/lineEnd (or ranges[]), checksum, and contextApplied.
Emit OSC 52 sequence so compatible terminals copy the result.

agent_playbook: Feed the `alias:lines` string from `blz search -f json` directly into `blz get <alias>:<lines> -C2 -f text` for the primary span.
Need multiple snippets from the same source? Repeat the alias (`blz get bun:41994-42009 bun:42010-42020 -C2 -f json`) and gather them from `requests[0].ranges[]`.
When you need a complete explanation, prefer `blz get <alias>:<lines> -Call --max-lines 80 -f json` so `requests[0].snippet` contains the entire section.
Cross-source comparisons? Call `blz get bun:7105-7164 turbo:2656-2729 -C2 -f json` and iterate the array at `requests[]`.
Store the checksum returned by JSON mode alongside your prompt payload to catch stale caches.
error_handling: If a range falls outside the cached document, re-run `blz search` to confirm the alias/lines combination and update the source if necessary.
If content looks outdated, run `blz update <alias>` before fetching spans again.
